title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Tuesday, 2 December 2015 - BBC News
summary: public consultation on where to build thousands of homes in cambridge and south cambridgeshire starts today .
the owner of a 100-year-old fenland business raises fears over wimblington supermarket plans .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: that 's all from cambridgeshire live
text: we 'll be be back tomorrow from 08:00 with the latest news , sport , travel and weather in the county .
if you have something to share with us , you can send us your stories and
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: raspberry pi in space : cambridge computer set for blast-off to international space station
text: the cambridge-based creators of the raspberry pi computer are making last minute preparations for two of their machines to be sent into space .
the specially-adapted astro pi computers will blast off on a cargo flight to the international space station tomorrow .
once there they will be used in experiments carried out by british astronaut tim peake ( above ) .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: posh 'aiming to become fittest side in league one '
text: goalkeeper ben alnwick says peterborough united are aiming to become `` the fittest side '' in league one .
posh have moved up to sixth in the table after winning their past four matches .
alnwick feels their current fitness levels are better than at any other time since he first arrived at london road .
author: Nick Fairbairn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: weather : some outbreaks of rain are likely tonight , minimum temperature 11c ( 52f )
text: some outbreaks of rain are likely , but it should turn drier through the night .
minimum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
you can find a more detailed forecast for where you live at bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: syria vote : south cambridgeshire mp heidi allen 'convinced ' by plan for military action
text: south cambridgeshire 's tory mp heidi allen has tweeted from the house of commons that she remains `` convinced '' by the government plan for military action in syria .
prime minister david cameron , labour leader jeremy corbyn and other politicians have set out their arguments for and against air strikes on syria ahead of a vote by mps .
i 'm listening to the full debate today in parliament , but remain convinced that @ twitterid 's plan for syria is the right one .
@ twitterid has the govt outlined any end game ?
what does success look like and what plan is there post-bombing ?
also , what can our
@ twitterid hi jon , if you email me , my office will send you my full thought process .
too much to squeeze in here !
@ twitterid thanks heidi , will do .
in the mean time , do you know what percentage of your constituents want you to vote for/against war ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid damn good question jon .
look forward to an answer .
ms allen , if you do n't know pls will you find out & report back
@ twitterid thanks paul !
would be good to know if @ twitterid has the backing of s.cambs constituents .
if not , then she should vote no .
@ twitterid @ twitterid and if ms allen does n't have the answer she should stand down as she is there to represent us not her own views .
@ twitterid our bombs achieve that the us/russia/turkey/france 's do n't ?
surely it just creates more refugees and long-lasting damage ?
@ twitterid please rethink - it 's impossible to bomb something which has no fixed place .
it will do no good & much harm .
@ twitterid
@ heidiallen75 party loyalty has no part to play in decisions about whether to kill people @ twitterid
@ twitterid @ twitterid pls see this statement by the french journo held by isis for 10months # syria
@ twitterid did bombing german cities end the holocaust ?
exit strategy in line with un is needed .
i think bombing alone makes it worse
@ twitterid @ twitterid sorry to hear that as case is so unconvincing to many of us who are specialists in m east affairs - do rethink
@ twitterid i 'm sad to hear this as i thought you would stand up for what 's right .
how will bombing stop terrorists ?
never has before
@ twitterid @ twitterid and the boots on the ground that hammond 's now admitting are going to be needed in addition to those already ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid ditto benjamin .
well said .
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid no its not there 's still children there omg
@ twitterid @ twitterid perhaps find a way to end the 25 years of bombing iraq first ?
then you can talk about a `` plan '' for syria .
@ heidiallen75 sorry to hear this because i am quite sure our safety in the uk will be at higher risk .
uk muslims already feeling ostracised
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : cambridgeshire mps take part in syrian air strikes debate cyclist left with serious injuries after cambridge crash
text: here are the main headlines in cambridgeshire this afternoon :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : police appeal for drivers to avoid long road area of cambridge following accident
text: police are asking drivers to avoid the long road area of cambridge following an earlier accident that left a woman in her 40s with serious injuries .
trumpington road - one of the main routes in and out of the city - remains closed to traffic .
please try to avoid long rd area cambridge , traffic at a stand still due to road closures to allow us to deal with an accident in the area
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: daffodils in december : spring flowers bloom in cambridgeshire
text: `` whatever happened to winter ? ''
asks the national trust as spring flowers bloom in the gardens of anglesey abbey , near cambridge .
cambridgeshire has enjoyed blue skies and sunshine today , and forecasters say temperatures are above average for december .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: trumpington road in cambridge closed following serious accident involving cyclist
text: trumpington road in cambridge remains closed following an accident .
police say a cyclist in her 40s suffered `` serious injuries , '' and was taken to addenbrooke 's hospital at about 14:30 .
update trumpington road # cambridge is closed , at jcts with brooklands ave & long rd due to an accident .
use alternative routes .
long delays
author: Alex Harris
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: woman in 'serious condition ' after accident on trumpington road in cambridge
text: east of england ambulance service has told us a woman in her 40s has been taken to addenbrooke 's hospital in a `` serious condition '' following an accident on trumpington road in cambridge .
two ambulances were called to the scene at 14:25 .
the road remains closed .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: prison sentence for wisbech man caught over the limit while banned for drink-driving
text: a driver from wisbech has been sent to prison after being caught over the limit - .
just two days after losing his licence for a previous drink-driving offence .
raimond glauda , 24 , was arrested after failing a breath test when his nissan x-trail ( above ) left the road , hitting another car .

at king 's lynn magistrates ' court , he also admitted driving without insurance and driving while disqualified and was told an immediate prison term was inevitable , given his initial driving ban was only two days old .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: nearly 500 student flats back on the table for cambridge as appeals are launched
text: nearly 500 new student flats for cambridge are back in the frame as developers launched appeals over two major schemes rejected by the city council .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: headlines : cambridgeshire mps take part in syrian air strikes debate man prison sentence for man caught over the limit while banned for drink-driving
text: if you 're just joining us here are the top stories in cambridgeshire this afternoon :
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: drugs company pfizer to close facility in cambridge
text: us drugs giant pfizer has announced plans to close a pain research facility on granta park in cambridge .
the company says it .
has entered into consultation with staff about the proposed closure , `` which could result in the removal of up to 120 roles from the company '' .
pfizer will continue to have a presence in cambridge at its global centre for the development of drug delivery devices such as injectors and inhalers .
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : one lane remains closed on m11 northbound near cambridge
text: one lane remains closed on the m11 northbound near junction 13 for cambridge due to an oil spill resulting from an earlier crash between two lorries .
for the latest on the roads head to bbc travel .
1 lane remains open # m11 n/b j13 - j14 # girton .
our contractors @ twitterid @ twitterid working on spillages + recovery .
delays on approach
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: cambridgeshire police visit homes at risk of burglary in crackdown
text: police are visiting homes at risk of being burgled as part of a crime crackdown in the county .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: weather : this afternoon will stay fairly cloudy and windy
text: it 'll remain cloudy through the rest of today , though some brighter spells may break through the cloud .
it will be windy but also mild .
above average temperatures for the time of year : 13c ( 55f ) .
you can find a more detailed forecast for where you live at bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: syrian air strikes : how cambridgeshire mps intend to vote
text: of cambridgeshire 's seven mps , only cambridge labour mp daniel zeichner says he will vote against air strikes in syria .
all six of the county 's conservative mps have said they will support the government .
david cameron is making the case for air strikes against the so-called islamic state in syria , saying the aim is to `` keep the british people safe '' from terror attacks .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire political reporter

documents.title: man left fighting for life after two-lorry crash on m11 remains in 'critical condition '
text: a man left fighting for his life after a two-lorry crash on the m11 closed part of the road near cambridge remains in a `` critical condition '' in hospital , police have said .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: syria vote : 'we simply can not stand by ' , says peterborough mp
text: `` we simply can not stand by , '' says peterborough 's stewart jackson , as mps prepare to vote on whether to back uk air strikes in syria .
the conservative mp says he will be supporting the government in the vote , which takes place after a 10-hour house of commons debate .
you can get the latest on the syria vote at bbc politics .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : cambridgeshire mps prepare for syria vote man dies after crash near newmarket
text: here are the top stories in cambridgeshire so far this morning :
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: syria vote : government plan not 'credible and convincing ' says cambridge mp
text: cambridge 's labour mp daniel zeichner .
has confirmed he will be voting against air strikes in syria , saying he does not believe the government has presented a .
`` credible and convincing '' strategy .
he says : `` uk military action in syria needs to have a clear legal basis - this remains in dispute '' .
mps will decide later whether to back uk air strikes in syria against militants from so-called islamic state .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire political reporter

documents.title: travel : crash involving two lorries closes one lane of m11 northbound near cambridge
text: a crash involving two lorries has closed one lane on the m11 northbound near junction 13 for the a1303 .
for the latest , on what has been a bad day on cambridgeshire 's roads , head to bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: man dies following a1303 crash
text: a man in his 80s has died following a crash in swaffham bulbeck yesterday morning , police have confirmed .
a blue ford and a lorry collided at around 10:00 near the junction with the a1303 .
the driver , from swaffham bulbeck , died later in addenbrooke 's hospital , cambridge .
anyone who witnessed the collision is asked to call the road policing unit on 101 .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: north east cambridgeshire mp to support syrian air strikes
text: north east cambridgeshire mp steve barclay says he will be voting for air strikesin syriaafter listening to the `` grounds for acting as well as the risks of not intervening '' .

the conservative mp , who served in the royal regiment of fusiliers , says : `` the house of commons has already agreed military action in iraq and given the lack of a clear border between iraq and syria , it is important to consider whether this existing action should extend to include syria . ''
the government motion would authorise air strikes `` exclusively '' against islamic state - also known as isis , isil or daesh - in syria .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'bad parking ' by drivers slammed for blocking life-saving ambulances in cambridge
text: paramedics are `` struggling '' to get ambulances through mill road traffic with the blame being directed at poorly parked cars .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: travel : a14 blocked westbound at godmanchester following crash
text: the a14 is blocked westbound at junction 24 for godmanchester following a crash between a car and a van .
drivers are warned to expect long delays .
police dealing with # rtc # a14 # westbound # godmanchester flyover , traffic queuing back to # barhill .
recovery is on the way
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: snooker : cambridge 's neil robertson into last 16 of uk snooker championship
text: cambridge-based neil robertson is into the last 16 of the uk snooker championship after a 6-2 win over thepchaiya un-nooh of thailand .
thepchaiya un-nooh missed the black that would have given him a 147 break and a prize of £ 44,000 at the event in york .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: mp lucy frazer to support government in syria vote
text: south east cambridgeshire conservative mp lucy frazer has confirmed that after thinking `` long and hard '' she will be voting in favour of military action in syria .
she says : `` as a government we have a duty - in fact , it is our first duty - to protect our citizens .
whilst some argue that taking action will have consequences the grim reality is that not taking action will have consequences , too . ''
a 10-hour house of commons debate will culminate in a vote on whether the uk should launch air strikes in syria against so-called islamic state .
author: Hannah Olsson
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire political reporter

documents.title: travel : a14 partially blocked eastbound at girton after crash
text: the a14 is partially blocked eastbound at junction 31 for girton , following a crash involving two cars .
for the latest on the roads head to bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: syria vote : uk right to take military action , says huntingdon mp
text: huntingdon mp jonathan djanogly says it is right that the uk `` accepts a part to play in taking military action '' in syria .
the conservative mp confirmed he would be voting in favour of air strikes today .
mps will decide later whether to back uk air strikes in syria against militants from so-called islamic state .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : a cloudy day , maximum temperature 13c ( 55f )
text: it will be rather cloudy today , but it will also remain windy and mild .
however , a few brighter spells may break through the cloud at times .
minimum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
you can find a more detailed forecast for where you live at bbc weather .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather
